input: The bar was so crowded there was no point in ordering a drink, and when we were finally seated we got no service at all for 20 minutes.
The price fix menu was a deal to boost downtown restaurants, atleast we didn't pay the full price.

We were directed to a table by a member of staff, which we were then informed was reserved, and lost our seats at the bar, all this after spending upwards of $30 each on very expensive drinks over a two-hour period.
The best thing though was when they messed up the fish order they not only gave us each a free glass of wine, but they took that fish order off our bill!!!
The food is decent at best, and the ambience, well, it's a matter of opinion, some may consider it to be a sweet thing, I thought it was just annoying.
To start with - the maitre'd forgot our reservation and then when it came time to sit us down - he told us we only had an hour.
It was somewhere between our waiter not knowing what sushi came as part of the tasting platter and the copious amounts of wine that he spilt while trying to pour me a taste that I realized.

The food is average, however the service is way below average (our waiter was a stuttering fool when it came to the specials and left our drinks empty for the majority of the night) The atmostphere is cheesy as well as the crowd.
I had to try the sweet tea, which was served in a plastic cup at room temperture.
When we went, the wait staff did not talk to us about any of the specials/the menu etc and handed us our bill while we were still eating.
The high light was the fondue, that we never got because again the server said the kitchen was too busy.
The last two didn't come to the people who ordered them until they already had there food ( in which then we had to remind the staff of).
Food is decent but portions so small that after 5 appetizers, 2 sides and three entrees, the three of us left still hungry!
When we got our food, the waitress barely said a word as she placed our take-out on the table and grabbed the check.
To enhance the dining experience, there is a live jazz band, which further isolates you from the world outside the gates.
If coming to Tea and Anthipathy (yea u heard me) during conventional dining hours, expect a good long wait on the curb till tables open up.
I went back to telly's because i heard that they changed the Chef and the food was again, after a very very small break, was excellent again.
Reserve a cozy window seat for more privacy, or hop onto a stool at the bar to dine solo.
The Wasa Waffle was different but when we spoke to the manager he inmediatly changed if for another dish (He suggested the Chocolate decadence French Toast.
We ordered the Tuna a la carte and Wild Salmon and chicken breast on the Prix Fixe.
I was shocked by the amount of butter used in the pork and lamb dishes -- the smell of butter was literally wafting off the plate!
Good Italian spot, but should raise the bar on the food before some newcomers challenge its standings.
Despite talking to the weekday manager on the prior Monday, who gave me a hard time but agreed to make a reservation for me since my group was so big.
While we were trying to have dinner, all of the waiters spent their time playing with spilled milk at the counter, not paying any attention to the diners.

Alongside the USDA prime dry-cut steaks, the menu features standard steakhouse fare: appetizers like shrimp cocktail, fresh oysters and clams, an array of salads, soups, pastas and vegetable sides, and non-steak entrees like lamb, veal and pork chops, lobster and more.
For the high price you would pay (dinner for the two could run $80), you sure do get alot.
The entree menu is not diverse, but the items on it are all very good.
The basil pepper mojito was a little daunting in concept, but I was refreshed at the flavor.
I don't know why the place was almost empty until 8PM, but the food and service were perfect for the price.
In all cases, service is slow but it's not the waiters fault.
We a menu that rearely changes,except for one or two specials, the quality and care they put in thier food in evident.

some old drunk guy who claims he is an American born in France seems to be a regular at the bar, he sat down next to us, listened to our whole conversation then started aggressing us verbally, and the waiter took the longest time to intervene.
Our waiter, even though he was serving dinner, was SO out to lunch.
Sushi pieces are smaller if u r a 'buffet' customer and choices are rather limited and there's really nothing special on the menu.
At one point, I spilled my water glass--when I informed the waiter of this he said he would clean it up--he never got around to it.
I went to Joy hoping to find some great Indian, but unfotunately found curry that was no better than average.
Ziti Bolognese is baked in a similar sauce, with ground meat mixed in and cheese melted on top--the menu offers many variations on this theme.
Kids love the tabletop crayons and coloring books, but the real crowd-pleaser is raw pizza dough--lumps are available at the open kitchen window.
I'd say the menu is generally below-average for the neighborhood, but if you want a burger, this is the place to go.

The place is a little over-priced for brunch but it is a nice restaurant so that was expected Food (i had the omelette with cheddar, mushrooms and herbs), service, coffee, atmosphere were all fantastic.
The menu is limited so I opted for the jalapeno potato soup and a romaine salad.
You get plenty of food for the price, enough leftovers for lunch and they actually serve garlic chicken with lots of chicken and chinese vegetables.
why go there to deal with staffs' attitude and eat bad food?
We reserved the downstair lounge for private parties and the price was fairly reasonable.
This is the only place that has great cheesecake in the Tri State area and they are famous for it.
Usually you lose food quality the trendier you go, but not at this place.
We ended our great experience by having Gulab Jamun (dessert) recommended by the waiter.
The mussels and frits were great, but the host had an attitude and my friends and I waited about 1 1/2 hours to be seated on a random Tues.
The Scene Service bustles through the energetic, sprawling space with the precision of expert merengue dancers, and everyone else goes along with the flow suggested by the tall, curving ceilings.
When after 2 hours we did ask for our entrees, the waiter and busboy were both extremely rude.
We were able to reserve a spot at the chef tasting bar with Morimoto who actually called in sick that night, but we were still charged full price.
